author: Simon Difford
description: Fresh, clean, sophisticated – dangerously quaffable.The use of powdered sugar instead of sugar syrup adds an attractive sherbet note to this cocktail. However, the drink also works well with sugar syrup – use ¼oz/7.5ml sugar syrup in place of the 1½ spoons of powdered sugar.
name: French 75 Cocktail
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle) (or use 5ml of 2:1 sugar syrup per spoon)
75 ml Brut champagne or sparkling wine

recipeInstructions.text: STIR powdered sugar with lemon juice in base of shaker until sugar dissolves
Add gin, SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass
TOP with champagne and lightly stir
(Consider pouring half the champagne into the glass first to help reduce foaming
